title: BASF and Sinopec open isononanol plant in China
text:
BASF and Sinopec open isononanol plant in China 13 October 2015 
German chemical group BASF and Sinopec have opened an isononanol (INA) plant in the Maoming hi-tech industrial development zone, Maoming, China. 
This is the first INA plant in China, and has a production capacity of 180,000t in order to serve the growing demand for next-generation plasticisers. 
The new plant is a joint-venture between BASF and Sinopec and will be operated by BASF MPCC company (BMC). "MPCC is one of the largest refining companies in Sinopec, with excellent economic performance that matches the foremost enterprises of the Sinopec group." 
BASF greater China and Asia Pacific president, chairman and president of functions Albert Heuser said: "The establishment of this plant is a perfect example of co-creation, bringing together the expertise of Sinopec and BASF. 
"This is also an important milestone for BASF because it helps us reach our own strategic goals. We are aiming to bring more of our production to the Asia Pacific region, where we will be closer to our direct customers and more closely in tune with the needs and the developments of key markets. 
"Our midterm goal is that 75% of what we sell in this region is also produced in this region." 
BMC chairman Yu Xizhi said: "MPCC is one of the largest refining companies in Sinopec, with excellent economic performance that matches the foremost enterprises of the Sinopec group. 
"As the leading chemical company, BASF brings both technological and economic strengths. 
"With this cooperation, the resources of the two partners complement each other, creating a win-win strategic fit that will boost the growth of both companies." 
INA is high molecular weight phthalate plasticiser used for the production of diisononyl phthalate. 
The high molecular weight phthalates, including diisononyl phthalate (DINP) is expected to drive the demand for INA in the future. 
DINP is widely used as a plasticiser in industrial sectors such as the automotive, wires and cables, floorings, building and construction markets. 
In 2013, Basf and Sinopec founded the joint-venture for isononanol production. 
Currently, BASF is engaged in expansion activities in Asia, and is planning to more than double its revenues in the region, from €13bn in 2010 to €29bn in 2020. Follow Us:
